definition[0]: to get money from someone by using threats
example[0]: Corrupt officials were shaking down local business owners.
definition[1]: to search a person or place thoroughly
definition[2]: if a new situation or arrangement shakes down, people start to get used to it and it becomes more effective
example[1]: The restructure has shaken down, and staff are showing a new sense of purpose.
definition[3]: to get money from someone, using threats
example[2]: The former business agent was charged with shaking down contractors.
